name: add
function: const add = x => y => x + y
description: Adds one number to another and returns the result

name: and
function: const and = x => y => x && y
description: Adds one number to another and returns the result

name: append
function: const append = x => xs => [...xs, x]
description: Appends an element onto the end of an array

name: both
function: const both = f => g => x => f(x) && g(x)
description: Returns the && of the boolean results of two supplied function applications

name: compose
function: const compose = (...fs) => x => fs.reduceRight((acc, f) => f(acc), x)
description: Successively applies a list of functions to an argument from right to left, where the output of each function application is the input to the next

name: elem
function: const elem = x => xs => xs.indexOf(x) !== -1
description: Returns boolean value whether element is in array

name: enumFromTo
function: const enumFromTo = m => n => Array.from({length: Math.floor(n - m) + 1 }, (_, i) => m + i)
description: Returns boolean value whether element is in array

name: eq
function: const eq = x => y => x == y
description: Returns boolean value whether element is in array

name: flip
function: const flip = f => x => y => f(y)(x)
description: Flips the order of arguments

name: head
function: const head = xs => xs.length ? xs[0] : undefined
description: Returns the first element of an array

name: id
function: const id = x => x
description: Returns the argument supplied

name: init
function: const init = xs => xs.slice(0, xs.length - 1)
alternative: const init = xs => xs.reduce((acc,x,i,arr) => i < arr.length -1 ? acc.concat(x) : acc, [])
description: Returns the array provided without its last element

name: last
function: const last = xs => xs.length ? xs.slice(-1)[0] : undefined
description: Returns the last element in an array

name: length
function: const length = xs => xs.length
alternative: const length = xs => xs.map(x => x = 1).reduce((acc,x) => acc + x)
description: Returns the length of an array

name: map
function: const map = f => xs => xs.map(f)
alternative: const map = f => xs => xs.reduce((acc, x) => [...acc, f(x)], [])
description: Applies a function to each element in an array and returns a new array of transformed values

name: multiply
function: const multiply = x => y => x * y
description: Multiplies together two numbers and returns the result

name: notElem
function: const notElem = x => xs => xs.indexOf(x) === -1
description: Returns boolean value whether element is not in array

name: nub
function: const nub = xs => xs.filter((x, i) => xs.indexOf(x) === i)
description: Removes duplicate elements from a list

name: pipe
function: const pipe = (...fs) => x => fs.reduce((acc, f) => f(acc), x)
description: Successively applies a list of functions to an argument from left to right, where the output of each function application is the input to the next

name: subtract
function: const subtract = x => y => x - y
description: Subtracts one number from another and returns the result

name: tail
function: const tail = xs => xs.length ? xs.slice(-(xs.length - 1)) : undefined
description: Returns all elements in an array except the first

name: zip
function: const zip = ([xs,ys]) => xs.map((x,i) => [x,ys[i]])
description: Takes an array of two arrays and returns an array of tuples whose elements are of corresponding index position
